title.narrative: PUBLIC WATER UTILITIES INCREASED CAPACITIES TO ENSURE UNINTERRUPTED WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: By 2022, Public Water Utility Companies and Municipalities in conflict-affected areas have increased capacities to ensure uninterrupted water supply and sanitation services to population

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/885 ACCESS TO SAFE DRINKING WATER AND REDUCED EXPOSURE TO ANY ENVIRONMENTAL RISKS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, Public Water Utility Companies and Municipalities in conflict-affected areas have increased capacities to ensure uninterrupted water supply and sanitation services to population

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF continued being one of the two leading partners, with ICRC, to the main water utility companies by providing water treatment chemicals, equipment, material and machinery, increasing their capacity to withhold external shocks and ability to respond to emergency, preventing the water supply to collapse. The assessments conducted since 2017 are used to shape the plans for the coming two years, linking humanitarian with Recovery and Development, with an assortment of hard and soft components, somehow innovative for UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020
